Package org.unibl.etf.epj2.rentals

Class Rental

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.unibl.etf.epj2.rentals.Rental
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Rental extends Thread
Represents a rental transaction, extending 'Thread' to allow simulation of vehicle movement. Manages rental details, including driver, vehicle, coordinates, malfunction, promotion and duration.
Author:
Tamara Kosovac

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Rental

      public Rental(String rentalDateTime, Driver driver, Vehicle vehicle, int firstStartCoordinate, int secondStartCoordinate, int firstFinishCoordinate, int secondFinishCoordinate, int usageDurationInSeconds, Malfunction malfunction, String promotion, MainFrame mainFrame)
      Constructs a new Rental object with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      rentalDateTime - The date and time of the rental.
      driver - The driver associated with the rental.
      vehicle - The vehicle being rented.
      firstStartCoordinate - The starting X coordinate.
      secondStartCoordinate - The starting Y coordinate.
      firstFinishCoordinate - The ending X coordinate.
      secondFinishCoordinate - The ending Y coordinate.
      usageDurationInSeconds - The duration of the rental in seconds.
      malfunction - The malfunction of the vehicle.
      promotion - The promotion applied to the rental.
      mainFrame - The main frame of the application to update the UI.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the rental.

      Includes details such as date, driver, vehicle,start and finish locations, duration, malfunction status and promotion.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Thread
      Returns:
      A string representation of the rental.

    • run

      public void run()
      Simulates the movement of the vehicle from the start coordinates to the finish coordinates. Updates the main frame to reflect the vehicle's position and battery level at regular intervals.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread
